alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; York (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 10:35PM EST until January 11 at 1:00PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following creeks in Pennsylvania... Yellow Breeches Creek near Camp Hill affecting Cumberland and York Counties. For the Yellow Breeches Creek...including Camp Hill...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Yellow Breeches Creek near Camp Hill. * WHEN...Until early Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Low lying areas in the Green Lane Farms development on the right bank of Yellow Breeches Creek begin to flood. A mobile home park near Williams Grove is also affected by high water. At 9.0 feet, A number of homes in the Green Lane Farms development are affected by high water. Cedar Cliff Drive on the left bank upstream from the single span bridge on Green Lane Drive is inundated. Creekwood Drive has several feet of water on it, and water is approaching homes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 6.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 8.4 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued later tonight.
